O: (A) Heat 4 cups chicken and waffles gravy and 3 cups water in a saucepan. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 cup chopped leeks and 1/2 cup chopped shallots and cook until tender, 5 minutes. Add 2 cups arborio rice and 1 teaspoon kosher salt and toast, stirring, 1 minute. Add 3/4 cup white wine and simmer until absorbed. Stir in enough warm broth to cover the rice; continue to cook, stirring occasionally and adding more broth as needed to keep the rice covered, until al dente, 18 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in 1 cup grated parmesan, 1/4 cup chopped parsley and 2 tablespoons butter. Season with salt and pepper. (B) Heat 4 cups chicken broth and 3 cups water in a saucepan. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 cup chopped leeks and 1/2 cup chopped shallots and cook until tender, 5 minutes. Stir in enough warm broth to cover the rice; continue to cook, stirring occasionally and adding more broth as needed to keep the rice covered, until al dente, 18 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in 1 cup grated parmesan, 1/4 cup chopped parsley and 2 tablespoons butter. Season with salt and pepper.

Question: Remove corn husk easily.
Choices: (A) Freeze corn before removing. (B) Microwave corn before removing.

Freezing the corn before removing the husk helps to loosen the husk from the corn, making it easier to remove. When the corn is frozen, the moisture inside the husk turns into ice, causing the husk to contract and separate from the corn. This makes it easier to peel off the husk without damaging the corn.
